I was thinking A as well

discussion.content: SSL Encryption will not detect. I will go with A file integrity monitoring. You can compare the hash values of a file and see if it has been modified.

Selected Answer: A
A. Implement file integrity monitoring.

File integrity monitoring involves regularly scanning and monitoring the files and directories on the web server for any unauthorized changes or modifications. By comparing the current state of files against a known baseline or checksum, file integrity monitoring tools can detect alterations made by hackers attempting to deface the website or exploit vulnerabilities to gain access to internal systems.

While changing default credentials (option B), using SSL encryption (option C), and updating web-server software (option D) are important security measures, they primarily focus on preventing unauthorized access and securing data in transit. They may not directly address the specific concerns about detecting website defacement or misuse for internal system attacks.

File integrity monitoring (FIM), sometimes referred to as file integrity management, is a security process that monitors and analyzes the integrity of critical assets, including file systems, directories, databases, network devices, the operating system (OS), OS components and software applications for signs of tampering or corruption, which may be an indication of a cyberattack.

questions.question_text: A network administrator wants to implement a switch management AAA method that will allow for per-user, command-level, granular permissions. Which of the following methods would BEST support the goals of the administrator?

comments.content: Radius is standard UDP, TACACS+ uses TCP authentication. The question ask for the "BEST" method, which is why it will be TACS+

discussion.content: Can someone please explain why the answer is not A:RADIUS? The difference between RADIUS and TACACS+ is that RADIUS combines user authentication and authorization into one profile and TACACS+ separates them into two profiles. TACACS+ would be more stable/secure, however, RADIUS should meet the stated requirements: AAA method per user, command level, granular permissions.
Correct answer is GSM.
the question states that the staff will travel internationally...since GSM is the global standard across most of the world this would be the best answer

GSM is the global standard for cellular networks. CDMA (Code Division Multiple Access) is particularly strong in the U.S., especially in rural areas. The Sprint and Verizon Wireless networks use CDMA. Most CDMA phones aren't meant for global travelâ€“though there are exceptions.

Many of these staff members travel internationally, and maximum compatibility with multiple cellular carriers is necessary. Which of the following wireless technologies should the hotspots support?

discussion.content:
OBJ-5.2: A protocol analyzer or packet analyzer (like Wireshark) has the capability to capture 
the handshake and display it for analysis. A packet sniffer, though, will only capture the 
handshake. Neither a spectrum analyzer or a tone generator would be helpful in this situation.

questions.question_text: A network technician is diagnosing a time-out issue generated from an end user's web browser. The web browser issues standard HTTP get and post commands to interact with the website. Given this information, the technician would like to analyze the entire TCP handshake of the HTTP requests offline. Which of the following tools would allow the technician to view the handshake?
